reporting-org.narrative: The Joint United Nations Programme on HIV and AIDS (UNAIDS) Secretariat

title.narrative: Strategic Direction 2. Coordination Coherence and Partnerships

description.narrative: Coordination, coherence and partnerships: the AIDS response requires collective action and continued partnership development with key development partners as well as civil society organisations, PLHIV and private sector. Strong coordination of diverse partners is crucial to ensuring efficiency, effectiveness, and country-owned responses to achieve the Strategy

title.narrative: UNAIDS 2012-2015 Unified Budget, Results and Accountability Framework - Budget for 2014-2015
UNAIDS 2014-2015 UBRAF thematic report - Coordination, coherence and partnerships
UNAIDS Performance Monitoring Report 2014-2015: Detailed Analysis
AIDS responses are gender responsive, country-owned, human rights-based, appropriate, coordinated and sustainable
D2.2.2a UN Joint Team contributed to strengthen civil society engagement in the national response
D2.2.2b National Strategic Plans benefited from a UN quality assurance/peer review

comment.narrative: All countries in need (of developing/revising their NSP in the past 12 months)

69% of Joint teams were involved in developing their country’s NSP in 2015 - The Joint Teams further reported that these NSP development processes benefited from external quality assurance/peer review by the following entities: ASAP: 65% Bilateral: 67% Other UN: 72%

title.narrative: Technical, political and financial partnerships and programmes accelerate social change

D2.1.1 UN Joint Team contributed to strengthen national capacity to adapt and use normative guidance, policy advocacy and technical support for the implementation of priority areas of the AIDS response

comment.narrative: In 2015, 91% of Joint Teams contributed to strengthen national capacity to adapt and use policy advocacy to implement priority areas of the AIDS response - 86% supported the use of technical support - 74% strengthened national capacity to use normative guidance

title.narrative: Implementation of evidence-informed, prioritized, costed national strategic and operational plans which are aligned to other sectoral plans and development processes to achieve Universal Access targets
D2.3.2 Standardised and recognised strategic information tools for NSP reviews are used with UN Joint Team support

comment.narrative: Spectrum: 98% AIDSInfo: 86% Modes of transmission: 73% Gender Audit: 73% National AIDS Spending Assessment: 60% Stigma Index: 59%
